intro: Macrocarpaea maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's macrocarpa, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white to pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
